metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2619 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Samba before versions 4.6.1, 4.5.7 and 4.4.11 are vulnerable to a maliciousclient using a symlink race to allow access to areas of the server filesystem not exported under the share definition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: samba package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.6').
